title: Demi Moore gets support from daughters Rumer and Tallulah while being feted over new book Inside Out
text:
Demi Moore while being supported at a book event by two of her three daughters said she likes to 'celebrate' her losses.

The 56-year-old actress thinks people learn a lot from their low points in life so as well as enjoying the good moments, everyone should be thankful for the things that go wrong because they make the highs seem even better.

Speaking at a conversation and private dinner Wednesday in New York in honor of her new memoir Inside Out, she told the audience: 'It's not the wins, but in our losses that we gain our depth and insights, and while it's great to celebrate the wins when they are there - don't overlook them - it's beautiful to equally celebrate the losses.

Showing support: Demi Moore was supported by her daughters Rumer and Tallulah on Wednesday while being honored for her new memoir and thanked them on Instagram

'Without them, we don't have the pleasure of really experiencing our wins. And [the book] is definitely a win.'

Among the guests at the Spring Place event were Demi and ex-husband Bruce Willis' daughters Rumer, 31, and Tallulah Willis, 25, who poked fun at the Ghost actress before she gave her speech.

According to the New York Post newspaper's Page Six column, Tallulah said: 'Mommy, I'm so proud of you and everything you've done in the book.

'Everyone is like, ''It's a whole night of you,'' which is so humble ... You do it like a champ.'

New memoir: Tallulah also shared a photo on Instagram with her mom Demi and sister Rumer at the event held at Spring Place by Bazaar and Ferragamo

Rumer recently praised Demi for being so candid in her book, which covers subjects including her failed marriage to Ashton Kutcher, being raped as a teenager, and her battle with substance abuse.

She said: 'I think so many women have watched her, and just as her daughter, I've watched her, as this beacon of strength and this kind of leader.

'What I really respect about her is that she is never the victim in her stories. She takes accountability. She takes responsibility, and mind you, this is her perspective, her story, and she's the first one to say that.

Candid book: The 56-year-old actress, shown last month in New York City, has been promoting her new memoir Inside Out

'She's allowing herself to show everyone that you can go through some really difficult, hard things, and you can still be someone who is thriving and taking accountability and just being a strong survivor without being, 'Oh, I survived this and this is who I am because of this story'',' Rumer added.

Demi also has a third 28-year-old daughter, Scout, with Bruce.

Bruce, 64, and Demi were married from 1987 to 2000.

Demi and Ashton Kutcher, 41, were married from 2005 until 2013.
description: The 56-year-old actress while being supported at a book event by daughters Rumer and Tallulah said she likes to 'celebrate' her losses.
